Operation 'post_/sendCode' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description has grammatical errors ('send's') and lacks critical details. Improved version clarifies: (1) that this sends an OTP (domain-appropriate terminology), (2) what input is required (email address), (3) what is returned (request identifier/status), (4) the side effect (email is sent), and (5) the workflow context (code must be checked with /checkCode). This helps AI agents understand the operation's role in the verification flow.

data.current_description: This request send's a code to the given email address, which should be returned to check it is correct.
data.summary_suggestion: Send OTP verification code to email
data.description_suggestion: Sends a one-time password (OTP) verification code to the specified email address. Requires the target email address as input. The code is generated and delivered via email by the EmailVerify service. Returns a request identifier or status confirmation. The email recipient will receive the OTP code which must be validated using the /checkCode endpoint.
data.reasoning: Original description has grammatical errors ('send's') and lacks critical details. Improved version clarifies: (1) that this sends an OTP (domain-appropriate terminology), (2) what input is required (email address), (3) what is returned (request identifier/status), (4) the side effect (email is sent), and (5) the workflow context (code must be checked with /checkCode). This helps AI agents understand the operation's role in the verification flow.

message: Operation 'post_/checkCode' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description lacks specificity about inputs required and response structure. Improved version: (1) clarifies that both email and code are required inputs, (2) specifies the response format (success status), (3) explains the verification outcome and its meaning, (4) adds context about code expiration (important for AI agents to understand potential failure scenarios). Uses consistent terminology (OTP) with the API domain and helps agents understand when this operation should be called and how to interpret results.

data.current_description:
Checks the user's emailed code is valid. 
If this returns success=true, you can safely assume the user you are interacting with is the owner of that email address.
data.description_suggestion: Validates the one-time password (OTP) code sent to the user's email address. Requires the email address and the OTP code received by the user as inputs. Returns a success status indicating whether the code is valid and matches the email address. If success=true, the email address ownership is verified. Codes typically expire after a set period, so validation must occur within the code's validity window.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about inputs required and response structure. Improved version: (1) clarifies that both email and code are required inputs, (2) specifies the response format (success status), (3) explains the verification outcome and its meaning, (4) adds context about code expiration (important for AI agents to understand potential failure scenarios). Uses consistent terminology (OTP) with the API domain and helps agents understand when this operation should be called and how to interpret results.
